title: The Wall Street Journal: Tech giants on the hook for billions of dollars after Supreme Court rejects tax-law challenge
text: WASHINGTON — The U.S. Supreme Court declined to hear a challenge to corporate tax regulations, delivering a victory to the IRS that will cost tech companies billions of dollars.

title: Facebook faces advertiser revolt over failure to address hate speech
text: The North Face, REI and other brands pause advertising on the platform in ‘Stop Hate for Profit’ campaign

title: Microsoft Pulls Plug On Mixer, Teams With Facebook Gaming, Enabling Ninja And Other Notables To Return To Twitch
text: Microsoft is shutting down its videogame streaming venture Mixer, announcing it will instead migrate its streaming community to Facebook Gaming.

title: Microsoft Is Shutting Down Its Twitch Competitor and Partnering With Facebook Gaming
text: Mixer had promise, but the platform's user base is now being encouraged to migrate to Facebook Gaming.

title: These are the companies that say they'll boycott Facebook for its hate policies
text: A growing list of companies say they'll join an advertiser boycott on Facebook in protest of what they say are the site's failures to stop the spread of hate.

title: Microsoft is shutting down streaming platform Mixer to partner with Facebook Gaming
text: Microsoft is shutting down its video game streaming platform, Mixer, after its growth failed to meet the company's expectations.

title: FB ad boycott won't move their needle, says Loup Ventures' Gene Munster
text: Loup Ventures' Gene Munster on what ad losses could mean to Facebook's stock.

title: Facebook faces backlash as advertisers defect: Which companies may be next?
text: Five Tier CEO Frank O'Brien on which advertisers may leave Facebook next.

title: Upwork CEO on pausing all Facebook ads in July
text: Upwork CEO Hayden Brown joins "Closing Bell" to talk about why her company paused all Facebook ads in July.

title: Facebook ads pulled over hate speech by Patagonia, The North Face and others
text: R "Ray" Wang, Constellation Research Principal Analyst & Founder breaks down the impact companies pulling advertising will have on Facebook.

title: Facebook Gaming is clear winner in teaming with Microsoft
text: The social-networking giant is the clear winner after Microsoft Corp.’s Xbox unit on Monday shuttered its Mixer video-game streaming service following an unsuccessful, pricey bid to  grab a large user base worldwide.

title: Opinion: Why Facebook, Amazon, Apple and other highfliers now look a lot like the ‘Nifty Fifty’ bubble stocks of the 1970s
text: Investors who buy regardless of price and valuation inevitably get hit with reality

title: Neiman Marcus in talks with Facebook about leasing Hudson Yards space
text: Luxury department store Neiman Marcus opened its first Big Apple location last year — and it’s already up for grabs thanks to the coronavirus. Developer Related Companies is in talks with social media giant Facebook to take over the three floors Neiman Marcus now occupies at Hudson Yards, according to a WWD report.

title: Facebook acquires VR studio behind ‘Lone Echo’
text: Facebook has been on a game studio acquisition spree over the past year, buying up developers behind some of the most popular VR titles. That trend continued today with the company’s acquisition of Ready at Dawn Studios, the developer behind the Lone Echo games, one of Oculus’s most successful series.

title: Here Are All The Companies Boycotting Facebook Over Hate Speech, Misinformation
text: North Face, REI, Patagonia, Upwork and more have pledged to pull advertising from Facebook pending “meaningful action” as part of the #StopHateforProfit campaign.

title: Big outdoor brands join #StopHateForProfit campaign, boycott Facebook and Instagram ads
text: As corporations fall over themselves to perform their mostly abrupt commitments to racial justice, a few companies are seizing the moment to call out Facebook for its own failings. A handful of the biggest names in outdoor gear have suspended ads across Facebook and Instagram for the month of July as part of #StopHateforProfit, an […]

title: Patagonia joins North Face in Facebook ad boycott
text: Outdoor apparel brand Patagonia will pause its ads on Facebook and Facebook’s photo-sharing app, Instagram, making it the latest company to join a boycott campaign organized by US civil rights groups. “We will pull all ads on Facebook and Instagram, effective immediately, through at least the end of July, pending meaningful action from the social.

title: Microsoft shutters Mixer game streaming platform, will partner with Facebook Gaming
text: Microsoft is shuttering its video game live-streaming platform, four years after it launched Mixer to compete with Amazon’s Twitch and others.

title: Patagonia joins The North Face in Facebook ad boycott
text: Outdoor apparel brand Patagonia Inc will pause its ads on Facebook Inc and Facebook's photo-sharing app, Instagram, making it the latest company to join a boycott campaign organized by U.S. civil rights groups.

title: Patagonia joins growing list of companies boycotting Facebook ads
text: Patagonia has joined companies like REI and The North Face, saying it plans to pause advertising on Facebook and Instagram next month to show support for a movement called "#StopHateForProfit."

title: As Apple gets analyst love, market pros bet on one other FAANG stock
text: Apple stock received more analyst love with Jefferies upping its price target to a Street high. Craig Johnson of Piper Sandler and Nancy Tengler of Laffer Tengler Investments discuss which FAANG stocks they like aside from Apple.

title: Facebook's Advertising Boycott Is Gaining Steam
text: Brands are bailing on the social media giant.

title: Facebook Buys Mapillary, Threatens Google & Apple's Map Lead
text: Facebook's (FB) acquisition of Mapillary is expected to support AR/VR initiatives and help it reduce the gap with Google and Apple.

title: Facebook: Here Is My Fair Value Estimation Of Instagram

title: Facebook Looks To Take Over Bankrupt Neiman Marcus' Retail Space At Hudson Yards: Report
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) is in discussions to take over luxury fashion retailer Neiman Marcus' space at Manhattan's Hudson Yards, according to a Women's Wear Daily report Sunday.
